sen.j: 京都将棋（きょうとしょうぎ）とは将棋の一種であり、二人で行なうボードゲーム（盤上遊戯）の一種である。
sen.e: Kyoto Shogi is a kind of Shogi, which is a board game played between two people.
Kyoto Shogi is a kind of Shogi, which is a board game played between two people.
Kyoto Shogi is a kind of board game that is played between two players.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1976年に田宮克哉が発表した、ごく新しい将棋である。
sen.e: It is a very new kind of Shogi, started In 1976 by Katsuya TAMIYA.
It is a very new kind of Shogi, started in 1976 by Katsuya TAMIYA.
It is a very new kind of Shogi, started in 1976 by Katsuya TAMIYA.

sen.j: 京都銀閣将棋、京都銀閣金鶏秘譜将棋とも言う。
sen.e: Also known as Kyoto Silver Palace Shogi, or Kyoto Silver Palace Kinkei Hifu Shogi.
Also known as Kyoto Silver Palace Shogi, or Kyoto Silver Palace Kinkei Hifu Shogi.
Also known as Kyoto Silver Palace Shogi, or Kyoto Silver Palace Kinkei Hifu Shogi.

sen.j: こう言うが香車の裏がと金だからで京都には関係ない。
sen.e: It is called that because the back of the lance piece is gold, and has nothing to do with Kyoto.
The game has the names because the back of the lance piece is gold, and it has nothing to do with Kyoto.
The reason why the game has this name is because the back of the lance piece is gold; it has nothing to do with Kyoto.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 駒を1手ごとに裏返すという斬新なルールで知られる。
sen.e: It is known for the unconventional rule that dictates pieces are turned over each turn.
It is known for the unconventional rule that pieces should be turned over each turn.
It is known for the unconventional rule that pieces should be turned over each turn.

sen.j: 大山康晴十五世名人が絶賛したとの逸話がある。
sen.e: There is a story that Yasuharu OYAMA, the 15th Shogi Grand Master, praised the game.
There is a story that Yasuharu OYAMA, the 15th Shogi Grand Master, praised the game.
There is a story that Yasuharu OYAMA, the 15th Shogi Grand Master, praised the game.

sen.j: ルール
sen.e: Rules
Rules
Rules

sen.j: ほぼ将棋と同様だが、以下の点で異なる。
sen.e: Mostly the same as Shogi, but differing in the following points.
Mostly the same as Shogi, but differing in the following points.
Mostly the same as Shogi, but differing in the following points.

sen.j: 盤面は縦横5マス。
sen.e: The board has 5 squares on each side.
The board has five squares on each side.
The board has five squares on each side.

sen.j: 自陣・敵陣はない。
sen.e: There is no home territory or enemy territory.
There is no home territory or enemy territory.
There is no home territory or enemy territory.

sen.j: 初期状態では、右図のように駒を配置する。
sen.e: The initial placement of pieces is as in the figure at the right.
The initial placement of pieces is as in the right figure.
The initial placement of pieces is as in the right figure.

sen.j: 駒は次の5種類。
sen.e: There are the following 5 kinds of game pieces.
There are the following five kinds of game pieces.
There are the following five kinds of game pieces.

sen.j: 動きは将棋のものと同じ。
sen.e: Their movements are the same as in Shogi.
Their movements are the same as in Shogi.
Their movements are the same as in Shogi.

sen.j: 玉 - 表裏とも玉将
sen.e: Gyoku – Front and back are both King (gyokusho)
Gyoku – Front and back are both King (gyokusho)
Gyoku – Front and back are both King (gyokusho)

sen.j: 香と（きょうと） - 表が香車、裏がと金
sen.e: Kyoto – Front is a Lance (kyosha), back is a gold "to"
Kyoto – Front is a Lance (kyosha), back is a gold "to"
Kyoto – Front is a Lance (kyosha), back is a gold "to"

sen.j: 銀角（ぎんかく） - 表が銀将、裏が角行
sen.e: Ginkaku – Front is a Silver General (ginsho), back is a Bishop (kakugyo)
Ginkaku – Front is a Silver General (ginsho), back is a Bishop (kakugyo)
Ginkaku – Front is a Silver General (ginsho), back is a Bishop (kakugyo)

sen.j: 金桂（きんけい） - 表が金将、裏が桂馬
sen.e: Kinkei – Front is a Gold General (kinsho), back is a Knight (keima)
Kinkei – Front is a Gold General (kinsho), back is a Knight (keima)
Kinkei – Front is a Gold General (kinsho), back is a Knight (keima)

sen.j: 飛歩（ひふ） - 表が飛車、裏が歩兵 (将棋)
sen.e: Hifu – Front is a Rook (hisha), back is a Pawn (fuhyo)
Hifu – Front is a Rook (hisha), back is a Pawn (fuhyo)
Hifu – Front is a Rook (hisha), back is a Pawn (fuhyo)

sen.j: 駒は成らず、その代わりに1手動くごとにその駒を裏返す。
sen.e: Pieces are not promoted, instead being flipped over each time they move.
sen.cmt: In standard Shogi, this means to flip the piece over
sen.e: Pieces are not promoted, instead being flipped over each time they move.
Pieces are not promoted, instead being flipped over each time they move.

sen.j: すなわち駒は1手ごとに性能が変わる。
sen.e: That is, they change their function each turn.
That is, they change their function each turn.
That is, they change their function each turn.

sen.j: 将棋同様取った駒は打てるが、表裏どちらで打ってもよい。
sen.e: Just as in Shogi, captured pieces can be played, but can be played either on the front or the back.
Just as in Shogi, captured pieces can be played, but can be played either on the front or the back.
Just as in Shogi, captured pieces can be placed anywhere on the board, but can be placed either on the front or the back.

sen.j: また最後列に歩や桂馬で打っても構わない。
sen.e: Also, pawns and knights can be played on the last row.
Also, pawns and knights can be played on the last row.
Also, pawns and knights can be placed on the last row.

sen.j: 打ち歩詰め、二歩は禁止されていない。
sen.e: The placing of two pawns in one row, and achieving checkmate by placing a pawn, are not prohibited moves.
The placing of two pawns in one row, and achieving checkmate by placing a pawn, are not prohibited moves.
The placing of two pawns in one row, and achieving checkmate by placing a pawn, are not prohibited moves.
